content: - exit thunderbird on new pc - copy the thunderbird folder from the ....appdata\roaming\ folder from old PC and paste into c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the exiting thunderbird folder. - restart thunerbird

content:
Николай Коханович said
Hello, I have the following problem: let's say there is a Word file on the desktop, if I right-click on it and select Thunderbird in the "Send" item, the window for creating a message with this attached file does not open, but the document itself opens in Word. Can you tell me how to make the window of message creation with this attached file open?

In Windows, the usual process is to select 'Send to' in the file context menu and then 'Mail recipient'. This will open a new message in the default mail app with the file attached. It sometimes fails if other mail apps like Outlook are installed and are conflicting with TB being the default app. In that case, define TB as the default both in Windows settings and TB Settings/General/System Integration.

content:
GDPR related information you are seeking have more to do with appropriate user behavior and how you manage the storage of information. And in the case of email, much more to do with those items and your choice of mail provider than anything specific to Thunderbird.

References:

  • https://www.google.com/search?q=%22gdpr%22+compliance+email+provider+or+service&oq=%22gdpr%22+compliance+email+provider+or+service&gs_lcrp=EgZjaHJvbWUyBggAEEUYOTIHCAEQIRigATIHCAIQIRigATIHCAMQIRigAdIBCTI0MDYzajBqN6gCALACAA&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8
  • https://www.spamtitan.com/gdpr-email-requirements/#:~:text=Strictly%20speaking%2C%20specific%20GDPR%20email,data%2C%20and%20not%20just%20email.

Disclaimer, I am no expert in this area, nor does Thunderbird provide legal advice.

content:
In essence, on 14.03 via zypper dup the whole of KDE was replaced.

Other Tumbleweed users reported freezing windows, windows with no content etc. The only way to get out of it was to find the process via ps aux and kill the PID. Alternatively reboot.

I can send you the zypper log if you want or a specific log. But which files caused the issue, I cannot say.

Please post an image showing the Folder Pane. When you say 'local folders' do you mean 'Local Folders' mail account ?

'Drafts' and 'Templates' both have icons that look like a letter, so it sounds like you may have a folder which has been set up to be the chosen folder for Drafts or Templates.

Check Account Settings

  • Account Settings
  • Select 'Copies & folders' for the account which has the folder with wrong 'letter' icon

Check the 'Drafts and Templates' sections. So for Drafts.... If pop:

  • Select: 'Drafts folder on: and choose mail account name/email address

If imap:

  • Select 'Other' and choose eg: 'Drafts on mail account name/email address

content:
re :Unfortunately, my computer (Windows 11 Home) will not let me open the downloaded "folderflags-1.6.0-tb.xpi" file.

You do not open it. Thunderbird opens it but you have to get it into Thunderbird first. Image below as guide. In Thunderbird

  • Click on the 'menu app icon' - it has 3 horizontal lines - and is usually located top right

It will show you a drop down list

  • Click on 'Addons & Themes'

It will open in a new tab

Now you should have the same view as my first image which I'll post again. In the left pane select 'Extensions' top right you will see a gear cog wheel icon - click on it to see drop down menu select 'Install addon from file'

A window opens and you need to locate where you downloaded that file. In the image it shows I had downloaded it to the 'Downloads' folder. select the 'folderflags-1.6.0-tb.xpi' file to highlight and click on 'Open' button- as shown in image. It then gets installed into Thunderbird automatically.

content:
Junk will get emptied if you have set up Thunderbird to empty it.

You will need the following settings:

  • Account Settings
  • Select 'Junk Settings' for the account

DEstination and Retention:

  • Select 'Move new junk messages to:

If POP:

  • Select 'Junk folder on' and choose email address of account.

If IMAP:

  • Select 'Other' and choose 'Spam on mail account/email address'

DO NOT select the checkbox 'Automatically delete junk mail older than...

Please note: If this is an Imap mail account then you may discover the server is automatically deleting the contents of the Spam folder.

Also check the Global Settings:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to 'Junk' section
  • Select: When I mark messages as junk
  • Select 'Move them to the accounts junk folder
  • Select 'Enable adaptive junk filter logging

Also check Junk/Spam folder:

  • Right click on folder and select 'Properties'
  • On 'Retention Policy' tab
  • Select 'Use my account settings'
  • Select 'Don't delete any messages'
creator: Toad-Hall

Do you know of any way to get them back short of going to my backup. I shouldn't have to do this.
creator: marymatthewscpa

content:
Are you using a POP or an IMAP mail account ? What server are you talking about? eg: gmail, BT, Yahoo, gmx, etc

Check to see if folder index file is out of synch with mail storage file try this to fix:

  • Right click on 'Sent' folder an select 'Properties'
  • click on 'Repair Folder'
  • click on 'OK'

What Anti-Virus product are you using ? Do you use anything like CCleaner or WiseCleaner to clean up files? Do you allow Anti-Virus or any cleanup program to scan Thunderbird profile folders ? If AV finds an issue they can try to fix the problem, but these products do not understand that one file may contain many emails and it's all too easy to lose all emails in a file. Ideally, you do not want any of those products scanning your profile folders. If you really want to use those products then make Thunderbird profile folder exempt from scanning. If you really do want AV to scan profile folders then make sure it must ask what to do and under no circumstances say fix it. But it should offer info on what it does not like so you can locate the problem manually, delete the offending email and then compact the folder.

creator: VonZipper

content:
The general advice is not to 'turn off' the antivirus, but to exclude the TB profile folder from AV scanning, while retaining the real-time background scanning that should guard against opening infected attachments.

https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Antivirus_Related_Performance_Issues#Norton_Security

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Antivirus_software

Test the effect of bypassing startup apps like AV by running Windows in safe mode.
creator: sfhowes

content:
La donazione è ovviamente facoltativa, anche se aiuta gli sviluppatori a portare avanti il progetto. La procedura che sto per descrive quindi è valida comunque anche se non si effettuano donazioni:

  • quella che visualizzi all'apertura del programma non è una email ma una pagina iniziale che riporta informazioni su Thunderbird ed invita a sostenere il progetto
  • per modificare questa pagina iniziale vai in menu > Impostazioni > Generale
  • nella casella Posizione puoi inserire l'indirizzo di una qualsiasi pagina web che ti interessi visualizzare quando avvii Thunderbird
  • se invece non vuoi visualizzare nulla, togli la spunta da All’apertura di Thunderbird mostra la pagina iniziale nell’area messaggi

content:
You are currently using 'Card View' You are also using 'threaded view' which will show a top level message and it has been 'replied to', so you will also see eg: 1 reply > The > chevron means it's in 'collapsed' mode

When you select the email in the list you will see all the threads in that conversation listed below in the 'Message Pane' area - that being the image you supplied.

It sounds like you want to go back to using 'Table View' where the Message List had columns like 'Date', 'Subject' etc

So first try swapping back to 'Table View' - see image below as a guide on how to restore 'Table View'

Then check you are using 'Sort by' > 'unthreaded' This will make each email a single email - one per line.

content:
Hi Toad-Hall,

Thanks for the reply. I've tried this but it wasn't the setting that I was struggling with. When I switched to table view I still had the same issue. My problem is that in the message panel on the right I used to be able to scroll through from one email to the next, even if I was in a sort setting that didn't include the other emails in the thread. It even had them nicely separated so it was easy to tell where one email ended and the next one began. For example, if I highlighted new messages and clicked one I was able to seamlessly scroll through the other messages in the thread. Now when I click it I can see only the specific email and the rest of the thread isn't available.

In the image below I have one email highlighted, and it's the only email I can access on the message panel unless I physically click another email on the panel on the left. It's especially frustrating when I get into long threads because I have to click through each email individually to find the part of the conversation I'm trying to reference.

Sent emails also used to automatically appear in the thread at the end of the conversation if I would scroll down so that I could reference what I said to a person as soon as I responded (without having to check the sent folder).
creator: dannymarchiori

content:
re :Sent emails also used to automatically appear in the thread at the end of the conversation if I would scroll down so that I could reference what I said to a person as soon as I responded (without having to check the sent folder).

An option is available and has always been available if you had opened an email using:

  • Right click on email and select 'Open Message in conversation' OR shortcut keys 'Ctrl'+'Shift'+'O'

It would include all emails both sent and received relating to the selected email.

There is an addon eg: Thunderbird Conversations 4.1.6

  • https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/gmail-conversation-view/

I find if an email was replied to then those replies are in the opened message in Message Pane - they are indented with a line. But if someone used original email and replied - not replying to a reply - then whilst it gets listed as part of thread, it's not connected to the other original which did have a reply. So in effect you have to select the next in thread. The change in not providing the vertical lines means you cannot tell whether that email in conversation was in reply to only original or in reply to a reply of original.

I'm going to check on whether there is a preference for enabling/disabling of vertical line in replies.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
A breakthrough! Perhaps this will help others and/or inform developers: I sorted all email in my local folder by email size and then moved smallest first, in batches. Though it failed once, it worked very well after. Allowing me to move thousands of email messages.

The good news is that my local folder with 35,000 messages is now down to 6,500 messages The bad news is that as soon as I started processing batches with email size over 25kb the move failed as before

The error TB notification reports is that the outlook.com server timed out.

So, I exported the remaining 6,500 messages as EML files (right click>save as) and will move them manually to the IMAP folder. (previously I tried <save as> EML for all 35,000 messages but that failed at about 8,000)

Though not as elegant as hoped, the problem is solved for me
creator: lake59

content: If you have antivirus scanning mail, it might affect uploading ('server timed out') of large messages with attachments.

content: I think the original method of uploading with the add-on should still work as long as the bandwidth limits are obeyed: for gmail it is 500 MB per day, not sure about outlook.com. Maybe the best way is to break the upload into folders no larger than 500 MB, or the provider's limit, and upload one folder per day. The limit might explain why the process was aborted when attempted with large numbers of large messages.

Por lo que me planteo pasar a un Outlook ya que este gestor comienzo a encontrarle más contras que ventajas. Muchas gracias de todas formas.
creator: clau100

content: Hola, Por solo no poder copiar un formato me parece demasiado decir "más contras que ventajas", de todas son opiniones. Para enviar sugerencias existe la siguiente pagina de Mozilla: https://connect.mozilla.org/?utm_source=sumo&utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=support Saludos
creator: pcp04

content:
If the same set of tags is defined on all devices, and the IMAP server supports keywords, the tags will sync. A simple test should confirm the server's properties. If the tags don't sync, consider using separate folders to classify mail and have these folders subscribed on all devices.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Tags#IMAP
creator: sfhowes
